messages.message: Do we know if it prod ready for customers to use? CC @Matt Weaver @Seb
We've typically only used it in university settings, but yes, the app is not in beta, it's been around for a while
NatWest are wanting to use it :slightly_smiling_face: so wanted to make sure before we let them haha
@Jessica Is this app very robust and are we confident in it's reliability? What further testing would we need to do to ensure it is suitable for NatWest to use in a critical production use-case?

What will they be using it for? This app has been around for a while so it is robust. We'd actually already planned to write some integration tests for it. If they're going to be using it, I'll also make a few usability tweaks to it beforehand

They want to use it to manually upload documents from another third party system into IB and then manualle push the output from IB to another third party system. They cannot architect a more elegant system integration in the short term as it will take a long time to get security sign off - so looking to use existing manual channels that have been approved in the interim and file submission app could fill this gap

The third party would still need to have an instabase account, is that okay? File submission is basically a UI on top of a copy operation that makes it so that the submitter doesn't need to have write access to the place it's being submitted to. The files already have to be in Instabase.
